alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:46PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Johnson County through 530 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodland, or near Clarksville, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Lamar... Hartman... Hoyt... Spadra... Woodland... Hinkle... Coal Hill... Hunt... New Spadra... Harmony... Union City... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 44 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Johnson County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County
